intro: Ophiorrhiza pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered sandalwood, is a shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, simple leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Ophiorrhiza pauciflora is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments.
